sn9.5:4.1: At one time Venerable Ānanda was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.
sn9.5:4.2: Now at that time Ānanda was spending too much time informing the lay people.
sn9.5:4.3: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Ānanda, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up,
sn9.5:5.1: “You’ve left for the jungle, the root of a tree,
sn9.5:5.3: Practice absorption, Gotama, don’t be negligent!
sn9.5:5.4: What is this hullabaloo to you?”
sn9.5:6.1: Stirred up by that deity, Venerable Ānanda came to his senses.
